oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Alvin C. York joins the party

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Men; Automobiles; School buses

York, Alvin Cullum, 1887-1964; World war, 1914-1918 -- Tennessee -- History; Motion pictures; Jamestown (Tenn.); Alvin C. York Agricultural Institute; Lasky, Jesse L., 1880-1958; Lasky, Jesse L., 1910-1988
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Alvin York (center) standing with film producer Jesse Lasky (right of York) and his son Jesse Jr. (left of York) in front of a building in Jamestown, Tennessee. Two other men can be seen talking to the left of York and his associates, and a man and woman can be seen standing near a car to the right. A dog is also visible in the photograph. A school bus is parked in front of the building, and the Jamestown Soda Pharmacy sign can be seen in the distant background.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Albert F. Ganier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Jesse Lasky, producer of the 1941 film "Sergeant York," is present. The film, directed by Hollywood veteran Howard Hawks, starred Gary Cooper as Alvin York. It was the highest-grossing film of the year, and Cooper won an Academy Award for his portrayal of York. Photograph by Albert Franklin Ganier Sr., who captured images of the meeting between York and Warner Brothers filmmakers as they researched the film, "Sergeant York."
